channel.title: I want to learn
channel.description:
First I have a question.
Say you add in a new shop with a new NPC. I have the XML all typed up + correct for it. Where do you go to change what the NPC is saying when you talk to them exactly? And how do you get an NPC to turn into a shop? ( If that makes sense ).
Secondly, I want to know if anyone wants to teach me some basics with RSCD and shit like that, going to work on a little project in my free time + learn.

item.title: I want to learn
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

[quote=“Miles`, post:11, topic:327286”]If you have msn, would you be able to help me on there?
2 servers are down atm that a bunch of my friends & I play, and I was trying to put a server public that i’ve been working on just XML and random stuff, but I don’t know how to port forward or set anything right. If not that’s fine.[/quote]
Add me; j.a.m.e.z@live.com

Read full topic

item.title: I want to learn
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

Yes it does, when you spawn the npc in npcloc.xml you have to have the same co-ords;

<minX>124</minX> <maxX>129</maxX> <minY>513</minY> <maxY>518</maxY>
as the shop co-ords that are defined, so they have to match up with npcloc, and shops.xml It will then work. You also have to define Ned as a Shopkeeper in NPCHandlers.xml in the conf folder, and get the npc and put npcid in the shopkeeper spot where the other ints are.

Read full topic

item.title: I want to learn
item.dc:creator: @Miles1 Miles`
item.description:
@Miles1 wrote:

Okay, so say Ned is in draynor. <Shop> <name>Ned</name> <general>true</general> <sellModifier>50</sellModifier> <buyModifier>100</buyModifier> <minX>124</minX> <maxX>129</maxX> <minY>513</minY> <maxY>518</maxY> <respawnRate>15000</respawnRate> <greeting>Can I help you at all?</greeting> <options> <string>Yes Please. What are you selling?</string> <string>No thanks</string> </options> <items> <InvItem> <id>135</id> <amount>3</amount> </InvItem> <InvItem> <id>140</id> <amount>2</amount> </InvItem> <InvItem> <id>144</id> <amount>2</amount> </InvItem> <InvItem> <id>21</id> <amount>2</amount> </InvItem> <InvItem> <id>166</id> <amount>2</amount> </InvItem> <InvItem> <id>167</id> <amount>2</amount> </InvItem> <InvItem> <id>168</id> <amount>5</amount> </InvItem> <InvItem> <id>1263</id> <amount>10</amount> </InvItem> </items> </Shop>
That does not make Ned open up a shop. And that does not make Ned say ’ Can I help you at all ’

Read full topic

item.title: I want to learn
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

Umm no, what source are you using? if you want to add a new shop, conf/loc/shops.xml

Read full topic

item.title: I want to learn
item.dc:creator: @Miles1 Miles`
item.description:
@Miles1 wrote:

No. That’s not the only thing, that just changes a current shops items. If you want to add a new shop you have to do something else.

Read full topic
